comment: Not a big whiskey taste here but a great cinnamon taste. One of my favorite cheap drinks but I love cinnamon.
Good as a shot in a nice apple or pear cider
Proof that marketing and syrup can persuade millions. Whisky in name only.
Liqueur. And terrible at that. This is for twenty year olds to take shots of in the bars (no judgement or shade, I drank cheap vodka in my youths which is no better).
I don't know how to party without Fireball.

Ugh. An abomination to whisky everywhere. The whisky equivalent to birthday cake vodka. 

It's either bad whisky masked by cinnamon or good whisky ruined by cinnamon.

It has many uses. Mixed with cider while camping, in flask to warm up on a cold mountain, party shots with buds when you were young. Not for a tasting with connoisseurs. Have to love it for what it is
It's not whisky... it's liquid cinnamon candy
As a sipper, tastes just like a cinnamon red hot candy.
I have had this about three times and the taste hasn't bothered me yet

It's fireball. You drink it to get wasted. What else is there to say about this? I put it on a level with Baileys. Sweet, pleasent, not that bad in taste actually. You know, stuff you drink when you don't care about a good dram and just want something soothing and alcoholic in your hand while having a good time with your friends. For that is has a right to exist, still, for the price you get actual good whiskey.
Did not like this whiskey at all.  The cinnamon absolutely ruined it.  Would not drink again.  Rate is 70
Not real whiskey but...Our go-to shot when out with people
To be clear, it's not the "good stuff" but it is a fun and tasty fireball of a drink. Plenty of good fun times involving this drink. Medium heavy burn.
Another one of my guilty pleasures. I used to fill wine glasses with this and shoot it. If I just wanna get drunk and have cinnamon breath this is my poison
Holy cinnamon. Reminds me of big red mixed with vodka (or Canadian whiskey I guess). Great shooter but hats about it.
Just like a sorority sister; fun to pass around, but best if you don't take her home.

Sweet and very tasty. This won't impress anyone with quality or complexity. It is a spicy cinnamon candy with alcohol. However it is so tasty that it goes well in any mixed drink. I'll happily keep drinking.

For frat boy shots and cocktails, this is the cinnamon whiskey to use. Why pay more for a name brand whiskey(Jack, Jim, etc) with flavoring when this will do the trick. Tastes of straight atomic fireball jawbreakers.
Amazing taste with the cinnamon flavour
Would only drink at a party if peer pressured to do so.
I like good bourbon, but I like Fireball too. it is what it is, and I like it.
Extremely simple whiskey. Very strong cinnamon flavor and aroma. Not much to this one. Good for a party. Good thing I like cinnamon.

Its fireball you all know what it is. I developed a love for it when they sponsored the Chicago Blackhawks. The bar I go to for the games would comp fireball shots for the house every time the Hawks scored... They won the cup a couple times here so you can imagine how many of these I've had lol. Either way, it's obviously a candy liquor. Its not something that purists are going to like but its an easy and fun party shot to get your buzz on before you go back to drinking more refined liquors. Take it for what it is and dont try to compare it to real whiskeys. Enjoy!
Of only I could give 2.5 stars. However, I'll give it 3 because of all the good college memories. Little class but a lot of fun.
More kick/spice compared to Jacks Tennessee Fire and Jeremiah Weed.
When she tells u she is conflicted, and you don’t care cause she’s so amazing.
when u are reflecting on the past week and craving cinnamon or 🍑🍑🍑 leverage...
Cinnamon, Cinnamon, Cinnamon. Perfect for a club or winter camping trip.
BETTY'S GO TO... although she might be making an adaptation!

The nose is sweet and overwhelmingly cinnamon scented.

The flavor profile is dominated by a sweet cinnamon flavor with notes of maple syrup in the finish.  The drink has a pleasant burn as it goes down, and an oily quality.  Terrible neat.  Best mixed.  Mixes well with colas, I'm curious to see how it works with eggnog.

Fireball, the cinnamon flavored drink that has sponsored way too many bad decisions. This is never something that you buy. it just shows up uninvited and you never really have the balls to say no to it making you forget any issues that have been plaguing you for a night.
Tastes like red hots boiled in gas station whiskey and late night college regrets.
The cinnamon is a bit overwhelming. Don’t recommend drinking it neat, solid for mixing though. One part fireball and two-three parts sprite is a pretty decent drink to sip on.
If you like cinnamon, great. I enjoyed this at first. That was a transient period. Overly sweet, syrupy, and nauseating.
Don’t mix it, don’t sip it, just shoot it. 2 starts because it serves its purpose of shots at your local shitty bar. The wife mixes it with angry orchard and that seems to do well.
Just not great.  Far to sweet and syrupy with a weird chemical taste.  I guess it would blend into a soda or something but I'd recommend Jack TN Fire if you want a decent low cost cinnamon whiskey.
mild, round taste. Nice to complement anything

Nose of Big Red gum or Red Hots. 

Not as fake flavoring as feared. 

Tastes like boozy cinnamon simple syrup. 

Mixed in egg nog and it really blends and creates a more spicy profile.
Very strong cinnamon scent and flavor as to be expected. Strong bite and a very sugary aftertaste. This is a drink you're gifted and go through in one night taking shot after shot

Nose: On the nose is sugary candy and Hot Tamales.

Taste: The taste is very cinnamony (Which I guess is what they were going for.) spicy and clingy.

Opinion: I'd only buy it as a mixer personally. As well as neat, I had some in a cinnamon toast shot, and it wasn't bad. Cheers!

Review transfer from Barreled from April 2017. 

I figured it's finally time to do a review of Fireball. A "Whiskey with natural cinnamon flavor" according to the 50ml miniature bottle I have. This NAS whiskey is 33% ABV. I do believe it is chill filtered and has colorant added. 

Wow!  Incredible cinnamon on the nose. Red Hot candies, a big ol cinnamon stick shoved up your nose. There is some elegant oak behind it once you get acclimated to the big cinnamon. Hints of maple syrup, pine, roasted nuts, and some unexpected mango and pineapple. It's really a wonderful nose worth spending all day on. 

The palate is even better!  Like there's a party in my mouth and everyone just celebrated the New Year. Big Red gum, Atomic Jaw Breakers are the dominate notes, but my oh my there is so much more!  Blackberries, figs, vanilla cake, chocolate cake, red velvet cake, Pop Rocks with Coke. Unbelievable!  

The finish of everlasting and full of oak and cinnamon. Can't get enough

What can I say?  It's just one of those whiskies that redefines what it is to be a whiskey. Oh and the best part is...


April Fools!!  
But seriously, this stuff is horrible and should be avoided unless you are tailgating or at a party with a bunch of 22 years olds, which should also be avoided. It's ridiculously sweet and full of artificial cinnamon flavoring with none of the notes I mentioned.   1 star
Really sweet but easy to drink. Tastes like red hots.
Not bad, really, for what it's supposed to be. Worthy of some cocktail explorations.
Very sugary, also very Red Hot-like.. slightly reckless and good tasting for noobs
Made me curl up in my bed in the fetal position questioning my life choices. It’s as if someone poured an entire box of red hots and atomic fireballs into rotgut whisky.
Definitely cinnamon flavor does not pair well with Whiskey...
Sweet and cinnamon-y. Low sting, simple flavor. Great with hard cider. Very candy-like, reminding me of hot tamales.
You gotta like it or else you won't! If I'm gonna have any fireball (which is rare!) I'm gonna drink it straight before I mix it with anything.
Great as a one finger pour over ice, or as a splash added to another flavored whiskey like Crown Royal Apple or Vanilla
Good for a shot. More cinn than average.
Strong and syrupy tones that mellow as the cinnamon rises with a long warm spicy aftertaste.
Fireball is what it is. Drink it straight like a shot of candy or mix it with some cider on a cold fall or winter night.

Doesn't merit 0.25 stars, if i could give it a negative 1000 rate, i would without hesitation! It so sweet!!!! WARNING: If you have diabetes avoid this product. Hey i love sugar but there is a limit and fireball violated that limit horribly. I have a passion for alcohol so it's rare for me to give such a bad rating but it's totaly worth it. Even if i was the biggest alcoholic in the world and you give me bottle of Fireball for FREE,i wouldn't take it. It's the worst bottle i have ever purchased in my life.
Not really a fan of many flavored whiskies, but this one isn’t bad. The whisky is smooth and the cinnamon is reminiscent of the old “Atomic Fireball”.
Strong cinnamon aroma and taste with a whiskey kick. Great with Coke.
Cinnamon Toast crunch when mixed w/ RumChata
This might be the worst thing I’ve ever put into my body.
Cinnerator is better but it's not as sweet as Fireball.
Artificial taste, but I like the smoothness and spice of the base whiskey.  WAY too sweet.
Tastes like hard Cinnamon bubble gum, raw sugar.. If you want to just get drunk its a great option. If you want to have a good whisky, you are far from it

This year for the holidays I’m going to try a brand new whiskey every day in December. #lifegoals

Dec. 27

I think this was either a joke or just an attempt to make me suffer after my Dickel Tobasco experience, but either way, this one comes by request from BeppeCovfefe. Thanks!

Nose: Red Hots.

Body: syrupy sweet. Tastes of poorly made cinnamon pancakes. There’s certainly the cinnamon, overly done, but there’s also a maple syrup sweetness there.

Finish: %¥?#. Unpleasant. It honestly kinda turns your stomach.

I remember that there was a time in college where this was used as a penalty whiskey during drinking games. Doing this now, I think attempting to taste this with sincerity might be worse than just pounding the damn thing. It does kinda make your stomach hurt. I honestly prefer the Dickel Tobasco. There was some interesting stuff in small doses there. This one is suffering from the first sip. Imma go find some tums.

Edit: after whining out loud about my tasting experience, my buddy told me to stop being a kitty cat and pound the rest of my glass. After doing so, I can say with confidence that this whiskey was made for pounding, not sipping. 

‘Tis the season. I don’t know if I actually have 4 more new whiskeys lined up, so if you’re reading this and there’s something readily available out there you’d like me to enjoy/suffer through this holiday season, leave it in the comments.
Tastes like whisky filtered through red hot cinnamon candies
It at first tasted a little nasty bitter but then a great taste of cinnamon it took my breath away literally it was a great whiskey and i recommend it if you like cinnamon.
While the taste is rather pleasant in very small amounts, it will very quickly overwhelm you with just how sweet it is.

Golden color, aroma is slightly sweet with strong cinnamon. The cinnamon flavor is very strong which really dominates the flavor profile. Some oak comes through in the background. Yes it is sweet for a whiskey, but I didn’t think excessively since it is a flavored whiskey. I liked it, but you have to be in the mood for what it is. If you love the atomic fireball candy you will like this, if you don’t you won’t.
Tastes like bad whiskey covered up by cinnamon. Great if that's what you're looking for.

Do you love candy? Have a sweet tooth? Feel like getting buzzed? This is the drink for you. Don't expect any complexity, richness, etc. It's 50% sugar so it's literally candy liqour. That being said, it tastes good.
Oof. Sweet Redhots in a bottle
the worst thing created by a human
-Taste like big red gum, smooth tasting
It's drinkable, but just barely. Smells and tastes like a liquid Red Hot mixed with alcohol.
For all those times you asked “how can I ruin my night faster?”
